extendedInfo.description: "And now, with no warning, it's backâand it's beautiful." - GizmodoDigg delivers the most interesting and talked-about stories on the Internet.  Powered by social signals and old-fashioned human judgment, our editors turn the Internet's vast and cacophonous flood of articles, blog posts, magazine pieces, status updates, photos and videos into the elegant and endlessly engrossing mix known as Digg. And now the new Digg Reader is a simple, powerful and speedy way to follow your favorite sources and publishers.â Introducing Digg Reader for Android!  A fast, clean, and simple real-time reading app.â Find and follow your favorite online publishers, writers, and bloggers. â Organize RSS feeds and other sources via folders. Quickly sort to see the most popular items across the social Internet.â Digg your favorite stories and share them via Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, Tumblr, LinkedIn, email, and text.â Save stories to read later on Digg, Instapaper, and Pocket.Have a suggestion? Trouble with our app?   Email us: reader@digg.com   Talk to us on Twitter: @DiggSupportMuch love,Team DiggâDigg captures a snapshot of all of the Webâs hottest streams. Then it presents a smart, gorgeous, editorially coherent digest of whatâs popular online.â - Slate"Digg doesn't suck anymore." - Ben Parr, CNET"Top 50 Best Websites of 2012" - Time Magazine

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: The app is really minimalistic and nice feel too it. It would he great if the images in the articles would be click able and would be enlarged and zoomed on if needed
reviews.author: Kwame Armah

reviews.title: Just missing a few minor elements but pretty good
reviews.comment: Needs a dark theme and a way to easily refresh the feeds.  Otherwise simple and effective . Desktop version is so much better than feedly I switched.
reviews.author: David Higgs

reviews.title: Minimalistic and user friendly
reviews.comment: Very nice! On desktop I switched from feedly to digg. The mobile app is just great!
reviews.author: Tasos Sangiotis

reviews.title: Clean, all I need
reviews.comment: Great, clean app. So much better than Feedly.   Just give me a default launch view and we are done!
reviews.author: Georg Galke

reviews.title: No scroll \'mark as read\'
reviews.comment: Decent app, but when I have a fee hundred unread items it\'s not very useful. Needs to mark items as read as they scroll off the screen like the website does.
reviews.author: Greg Johnson

reviews.title: Feedly uninstalled!
reviews.comment: Excellent job!   My feed reader world is now BETTER than is was before Google pulled GReader.  Thanks folks :)
reviews.author: Dave Mitchell

reviews.title: Get your crap out of my way
reviews.comment: I want to see MY stories, not Digg stories.  Also was without internet all weekend, and now I only see new stories within the last three hours.  Where\'s the rest of my stuff?
reviews.author: Nick Walke

reviews.title: Dark theme please
reviews.comment: It\'s clean, but needs a dark theme and a list view. Also, crashes frequently on my galaxy nexus using android 4.3.
reviews.author: Christos Kotsakas

reviews.title: Expected better
reviews.comment: After 2 months I expected more, there is no only show undead option, and no option to set what feed it opens to rather goes to the digg blog top stories.
reviews.author: Louis Snyder

reviews.title: Simple and clean, but..
reviews.comment: Need some features: set default view, smaller font, option to display only unread, widget with my own feeds.
reviews.author: Cristiano Dias

reviews.title: Forced portrait mode?
reviews.comment: This app opens in portrait orientation mode on my tablet, for some bizzare reason. Could you fix this, or make a tablet version that opens in landscape? Other than that, it looks nice and would love to use it once it\'s fixed.
reviews.author: james handshoe

reviews.title: Needs a little improvement on the reader
reviews.comment: Also, no don\'t customization options are available. But, great to finally see digg on android
reviews.author: Amandeep Singh Shienh

reviews.title: Missing dark version
reviews.comment: And also I can\'t \"share\" without liking first. And if I like another article, then press share on a new one, it will share the previous...
reviews.author: Andr\303\251 Prata

reviews.title: keeps craching
reviews.comment: used twice, it crashed 7 times. moreover, there seems to be no way to mark as read unless you actually read it. useless. uninstalled
reviews.author: Luigi Scorzato

reviews.title: Good start
reviews.comment: Add more personalization settings like font and font size changing and it\'s perfect!
reviews.author: Giorgos Polydoros

reviews.title: Great Start
reviews.comment: A couple of requests. Mark as read as the item is scrolled, sometimes all I read is the headline so a setting to mark as read when its scrolled off the screen without having to open would be nice also a hide read option would be great and a dark theme.. its easier on the eyes and the battery then white.
reviews.author: Keith Rea

reviews.title: Syncing subscriptions?
reviews.comment: Seems a bit odd that, despite being signed in, my reader subscriptions aren\'t syncing between the app and the website.  Other than that glaring mistake, I like the app.
reviews.author: Erik Bates

reviews.title: Good first version!
reviews.comment: Would love to have a dark theme and a view with larger images kinda like the top stories view.
reviews.author: Tam\303\241s M\303\274ller

reviews.title: Hello Digg. Goodbye Feedly (almost)
reviews.comment: Nice and simple app. Very promising. Way smoother than Feedly. However, this app needs alot of improvements and features. I\'ll use both services until this app is good enough for me to ditch Feedly.
reviews.author: Rook HD

reviews.title: Nice interface... but...
reviews.comment: Missing two key features:  * auto rotate when a tablet is rotated to landscape mode. * automatic mark as read when scrolling between articles
reviews.author: Bechir Zalila
